cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the Yucatán Channel, then turning north-northwest to north toward the central Louisiana coastline and the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-southwest Louisiana coast (near Cameron–Morgan City area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas upper coast eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes — outer rain-bands could dump 4+ inches Thursday–Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes — onshore flow may push 2–4 ft into Sabine Pass and lower Neches River
weather_observation.wind: Low-to-moderate chance (≈27%) of sustained 34-kt winds, gusts 40–50 mph possible late Thu into early Fri; hurricane-force winds unlikely (<4%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft inundation near the Sabine Lake entrance; lesser (1–3 ft) farther up the ship channel
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with locally higher totals over 4 inches, especially if rain-bands pivot west of the center
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding, elevated river/industrial canal levels, short-period seas >8 ft at the bar channel likely to halt pilotage and lightering operations
